alert.note: Alert for Dundy; Hitchcock; Red Willow (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Wind Chill Watch issued December 19 at 5:10PM CST until December 23 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY EVENING THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY EVENING THROUGH LATE THURSDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Watch, bitterly cold and life threatening wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 50 degrees below zero. For the Winter Storm Watch, moderate to heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of up to two to three inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 50 mph, creating significant areas of blowing snow and near blizzard conditions. * WHERE...Portions of northwest Kansas and southwest Nebraska. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Watch, from Wednesday night through Friday morning. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Wednesday night through early Friday morning. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Blowing snow will likely create near blizzard conditions and significant reductions in visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. The bitterly cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Life threatening cold conditions will persist for nearly 36 hours. Snow and blowing snow will likely create near blizzard conditions Wednesday night causing travel to be very hazardous. Road closures are possible.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
